TRAIL, FasL and Fas, which are further transcriptional targets of FOXO, can control cell cycle and apoptosis [31], [33]–[37]. TRAIL expression level increased at 12 h p.i. when CCoV-II-induced apoptosis starts, as previously described. mitochondrial sirtuins, SIRT3 and SIRT4, are able to inhibit cell death by maintaining constant mitochondrial NAD+ levels following stress. apoptotic protein bax translocates from the cytosol to the mitochondrial compartment, while the antiapoptotic protein Bcl-2 was down-regulated in the cytosolic compartment. TRAIL may be a primary mediator of CCoV-II-induced apoptosis. the mitochondrion plays a critical role in a host defense mechanism. we believe that both the activation of extrinsic apoptotic pathway and the activation of intrinsic apoptotic pathway occurred during CCoV-II infection.
